name: Dr. Alex Gathura Kagia
title: Consultant Obstetrician-Gynaecologist
bio: Dr. Alex Gathura Kagia is a Consultant Obstetrician-Gynaecologist at The Nairobi Hospital with over eight years of specialist experience. He has been practising as an Obs-Gyn consultant since completing his MMed in 2017. Previous roles include Senior Medical Officer at The Nairobi Hospital, Medical Superintendent at Moyale District Hospital, and Medical Officer at Kathiani Sub-District Hospital and Coast Provincial General Hospital. He holds an MBChB (University of Nairobi, 2007) and MMed in Obstetrics & Gynaecology (University of Nairobi, 2017) and is passionate about women’s reproductive health, endometriosis, and safe surgical care.
yearsOfExperience: 8+ years as specialist (17+ years in medicine)
location: The Nairobi Hospital - Anderson Specialty Clinic
servicesOffered: Normal vaginal deliveries and caesarean sections
Minor and major gynaecological surgeries (laparoscopic & open)
Fertility evaluation and basic infertility treatment
awardsAndRecognition: Outstanding Resident Award - University of Nairobi MMed Programme (2017), Nairobi Hospital Long-Service Recognition (2023)
researchAndPublications: Prevalence of pain symptoms suggestive of endometriosis among women attending gynaecology clinics in Kenya - East African Medical Journal, 2017

name: Dr. Ann Kamunya
title: Consultant Paediatric Neurologist
bio: Dr. Ann Kamunya is a paediatric neurologist based at Ubuntu Neurology and Kenyatta University Teaching & Referral Hospital. She trained in paediatric neurology with a fellowship at Inkosi Albert Luthuli Hospital, University of KwaZulu‑Natal, South Africa, and contributes to training through the Paediatric Epilepsy Training Course in partnership with the British Paediatric Neurology Association. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}
medicalQualifications: MBChB, MMed, Certificate in Paediatric Neurology (UKZN fellowship):contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}
location: Ubuntu Neurology / Kenyatta University Teaching & Referral Hospital

name: Dr. Chifor Mfu Theresia
title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Chifor Mfu Theresia is a compassionate and internationally experienced Paediatrician committed to safeguarding child health through evidence-based care, accurate diagnosis, and culturally sensitive practice. With 10 years of experience, she has worked across diverse contexts, offering holistic, child-centred solutions aligned with international and national paediatric guidelines. Known for empathetic engagement, she excels in problem-solving and managing complex paediatric conditions. Dr. Chifor collaborates within multidisciplinary teams, contributing through teaching, coaching, and data-driven insights. She is an active social media advocate, promoting child health and empowering communities.
medicalQualifications: MD, MMED in Paediatrics and Child Health, PGDP in Child Nutrition
clinicDepartment: Paediatric department, nursery, St Marys and Anderson clinics
researchAndPublications: Prevalence and determinants of antibiotic self-medication among adult patients with respiratory tract infections in the Mboppi Baptist Hospital, Douala, Cameroon: a cross-sectional study (co-author, PubMed 2018); Research and thesis on ‘Assessment of Nutritional Status and Dietary Diversity Amongst HIV–Positive Patients Attending The Limbe Regional Hospital’; Clinical Researcher-MD Research Group (2016); Sacral Perineural (Tarlov) Cyst: A rare presentation in an Adolescent in Cameroon (co-author, accepted for publication in The Journal of Medical Research); A qualitative study on exploration of feeding practices in Bomachoge Borabu sub county Nairobi (poster, KPA 2023); Thesis: Antimicrobial prescription practices amongst neonates with early onset neonatal sepsis in Mboppi and Bonaberi Baptist hospitals Cameroon

name: Damaris Kavindu Mbalu
title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Damaris Kavindu Mbalu is a General Surgeon and Team Leader of the Hospital Surgery Team at The Nairobi Hospital, with 15 years of experience. Trained at Moi University (MBChB) and under COSECSA (FCS GS), she has a decade of expertise in adult surgery and a passion for paediatric surgery, delivering high-quality surgical care.
awardsAndRecognition: Leadership in Management in Health, University of Washington (June 2021); Advanced Trauma Life Support (Feb 2021)

name: Fahmo Mohamed Yusuf
title: Doctor- Senior Registrar
bio: Dr. Fahmo Mohamed Yusuf is a highly motivated Paediatrician at The Nairobi Hospital with 10 years of experience. She holds an MBChB from Emilio Aguinaldo College and an MMed from the University of Nairobi. Dedicated to providing compassionate and comprehensive care, she specializes in diagnosing and treating paediatric illnesses and injuries, with strong communication skills to build rapport with young patients and their families.

title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Joram Mugo Muthui is a compassionate Obstetrician-Gynaecologist at The Nairobi Hospital with seven years of experience. He is dedicated to providing comprehensive and quality reproductive health care to women of all ages, specializing in consultations, diagnostic evaluations, and surgeries.

name: Lauryn Busolo Mengesa
title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Lauryn Busolo Mengesa is a young Obstetrician-Gynaecologist at The Nairobi Hospital with 12 years of experience. Trained at the University of Nairobi (MBChB, MMed), she was Deputy Chief Resident and is passionate about women’s health, fertility medicine, and global surgery. With certifications from the University of Washington and Oxford, she focuses on equitable, evidence-based care. A fellow of EV4GH (2022) and APHRC, she volunteers with Safari Doctors and has presented research at KOGS, HSG (Colombia, 2022), and West African Infectious Diseases Conference (Sierra Leone, 2024).
awardsAndRecognition: Certifications from University of Washington in Leadership in Healthcare and Monitoring and Evaluation; Trained in Global Surgery at University of Oxford; Fellow of Emerging Voices for Global Health (EV4GH 2022); Fellow of African Population & Health Research Centre (APHRC)
researchAndPublications: Phyllodes tumor, cardiovascular and chronic renal disease in a young lady on hormone replacement therapy: A case report (JOGECA, 2024); Awaiting publication: Return to Fertility after Use of Subcutaneous Depot Medroxyprogesterone Acetate 104 mg; Association between Hypertensive Disorders in Pregnancy and Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes among Women with SARS-CoV-2

name: Leah Akoth Opere
title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Leah Akoth Opere is a Senior Registrar in Anaesthesia and Critical Care at The Nairobi Hospital with 10 years of experience. With an MBChB and MMed from the University of Nairobi, she developed a passion for critical care during her internship at Mater Hospital and worked in The Nairobi Hospital ICU for 5 years. She volunteers as an anaesthesia provider at medical camps, specializing in advanced airway management and critical care interventions.
servicesOffered: Advanced airway placement and mechanical ventilation
Incident command and mass triage in acute trauma
researchAndPublications: Predictors of weaning success in mechanically ventilated patients at KNH critical care unit

name: Ngala Bryan Mwendwa
title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Ngala Bryan Mwendwa is a board-certified Paediatrician at The Nairobi Hospital with over 12 years of experience. A member of the Kenya Paediatric Association, he is passionate about child health and welfare, establishing himself as a regional healthcare advocate through social media. He holds an MD and MMed in Paediatrics and Child Health, providing specialized care in delivery, neonatal resuscitation, and immunizations.
clinicDepartment: The Nairobi Hospital Department of Paediatrics

name: Njengo Beatrice Mbanga
title: Doctor- Senior Registrar
bio: Dr. Njengo Beatrice Mbanga is an Anaesthesiologist at The Nairobi Hospital with 12 years of experience (10 years as a medical officer, 2 years as a specialist). Trained at Kilimanjaro Christian Medical College (MBChB) and Muhimbili University (MMed Anaesthesia), she worked in the paediatric department at Aga Khan University Hospital for five years before specializing. She provides expert anaesthesia care and post-operative reviews.
schedule: Tuesday night, Thursday day, Friday night, every alternate weekend

name: Omina Brian Odari
title: Doctor
bio: As the medical liaison officer for The Nairobi Hospital, Dr. Omina Brian Odari specializes in global health management. With 12 years of experience, he has repaired relationships with UNSOS, International SOS, and AMREF, increasing patient referrals. He facilitated partnerships with UNISURE, Kings Hospital London-Dubai, and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, and secured TNH as a primary healthcare provider for UN peacekeeping missions. Dr. Odari also established referral programs with the Malawi government and African Union, and is facilitating TNH’s participation in the East African Health Expo 2023.
licensingDetails: Kenya Medical practitioners and dentist board

name: Paediatric Specialist
title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Paediatric Specialist is a dedicated Paediatric Specialist with over 5 years of experience delivering outstanding patient care in busy paediatric clinics and hospitals. Committed to enhancing health outcomes through exceptional care, they provide top-quality treatment, including vaccinations, physical exams, and procedures. Skilled in diagnosing and treating various illnesses, ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests, and managing patient information, they excel in prescribing treatments and explaining procedures to families. With a fellowship in Paediatric Emergency & Critical Care and an ongoing MPH, they are passionate about paediatric emergencies, neonatology, child development, public health, and clinical research.
medicalQualifications: MBChB, MSc (Paediatrics & Child Health), MPH (ongoing), Fellowship in Paediatric Emergency & Critical Care (ongoing)
licensingDetails: Kenya Medical Practitioners and Dentists Council
awardsAndRecognition: Certificate in Leadership & Management (2024); HEPI Research Course (2021)

name: Paul Kamau Koigi
title: Dr.; HOD Research
bio: Dr. Paul Kamau Koigi is a consultant Obstetrician-Gynaecologist and Sub-specialist in Reproductive Endocrinology and Fertility at The Nairobi Hospital, with 16 years of experience. He serves as Ag. Asst. Secretary General of the Fertility and Andrology Society of Kenya, Chairman of the KOGS Scientific Committee, and Deputy Editor-in-Chief of JOGECA. With an MBChB, M.Med Obs/Gyn, MCOG(ECSA), PGD-SRM, MSC-SRM, and ongoing PhD, he is a teacher, media health influencer, and contributor to two books and national guidelines. He has 100 peer-reviewed publications and serves as a grants reviewer for the John and Catherine McArthur Foundation.
medicalQualifications: MBChB, M.Med Obs/Gyn, MCOG(ECSA), PGD-SRM, MSC-SRM, RRWEM, PhD (ongoing)
clinicDepartment: HOD Research; TNH Med J; Obs/Gyn Department
schedule: Monday Noon to 5 pm (Anderson), Tuesday 9 am to 1pm (Southfield)
licensingDetails: Kenya Medical Practitioner and Dentists Board: Medical License 2011, Specialist recognition 2018, Subspecialist recognition 2024
awardsAndRecognition: Best Postgraduate student in Obstetrics and Gynaecology (2016); Alignment of ECSACOG curriculum with KMPDC (2018-2019); Founder member of Clinical Research Society of Kenya; Founder member of Africa Reproductive Care Society; KOGS National Governing Council (2017-2021); CPD coordinator and Ag. Asst. Secretary General of FASK (2021-present); Meritorious recognition for JOGECA (2019); Excellence in leadership for JOGECA (2020); Medal and certificate for PGD-SRM, University of South Wales (2024); Certificate of appreciation from The Nairobi Hospital for Innovations Evaluation Committee (2024)
researchAndPublications: Sub-Principal Investigator for Phase IV clinical trial on diabetic macular edema; 100 publications, including: https://www.glowm.com/author-contribution/type/continuous/item/15233; Contributed to two Kenya National guidelines on Reproductive Health Care
socialMedia: LinkedIn: Paul Koigi; Facebook: Dr. Paul Koigi; Instagram: dr_paul_koigi; ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6775-2184; Wiley Author Services: Dr. Paul Koigi; Clarivate Web of Science: Dr. Paul Koigi

name: Peace Mukami Mwige
title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Peace Mukami Mwige is a General Surgeon at The Nairobi Hospital with 10 years of experience. With an MBChB and MMed in General Surgery, she provides world-class medical and surgical care, working collaboratively in multidisciplinary settings. She is committed to staying updated with advances in medicine and surgery, participating in research, and practicing evidence-based medicine to ensure optimal patient outcomes.
researchAndPublications: Incidence of post-thyroidectomy hypocalcaemia in KNH – UON repository

name: Peris Mbatha Mutuku
title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Peris Mbatha Mutuku is a Consultant Physician and Lead Nephrologist at The Nairobi Hospital, specializing in peritoneal dialysis. With 12 years of experience, she holds an MBChB from Makerere University, an M.Med in Internal Medicine from the University of Nairobi, and fellowships from the International Society of Nephrology (ISN) and International Society of Peritoneal Dialysis (ISPD). She has critical care and aeromedical evacuation experience, and is a Trainer of Trainers in BLS, ACLS, and PHTLS. As an ISPD Early Career Committee Member representing Africa, she is affiliated with the Kenya Renal Association, African Association of Nephrology, ISN, and ISPD, with a keen interest in critical care and interventional nephrology.
medicalQualifications: MBChB, M.Med(Int.Med); FISN (Nephrology), ISPD Fellow (Peritoneal Dialysis)
schedule: Tuesday 10 am-3 pm, Friday 11 am-3 pm Anderson clinic
awardsAndRecognition: Won 1st prize for E-poster Abstract presentation of the publication: Point of Care lactate as a predictor of 7-day Morbidity and Mortality in critically ill patients presenting to the emergency department at Kenyatta National Hospital.
researchAndPublications: Journal of Pan African Thoracic Society (JPATS). Published on 30th September 2023: Point of Care lactate as a predictor of 7-day Morbidity and Mortality in critically ill patients presenting to the emergency department at Kenyatta National Hospital.

name: Rahul Ramkrishna Zode
title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Rahul Ramkrishna Zode is an experienced M.D. in Pathology from Mumbai, India, with over 14.5 years in the field. As Chief Pathologist at The Nairobi Hospital, he is a qualified internal auditor for ISO 15189 and a member of the Indian Association of Pathologists & Microbiologists. His expertise is recognized through co-authoring four index publications, contributing significantly to pathology and laboratory medicine.
awardsAndRecognition: Advisor for IVD Instruments at the Pharmacy and Poisons Board (PPB) in Kenya

name: Rohini Kalagouda Patil
title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Rohini Kalagouda Patil is a dedicated Paediatrician and Pediatric Critical Care Specialist at The Nairobi Hospital since January 2021, with over a decade of experience. She provides clinical care for critical and non-critical conditions, including neurological, cardiac, trauma, poisoning, metabolic, and postsurgical cases. Passionate about pediatric sepsis, hospital-acquired infections, and antimicrobial stewardship, she holds an MBBS and MD (Pediatrics) from Rajiv Gandhi University, a Fellowship in Pediatric Intensive Care, and MRCPCH-UK. Dr. Patil spearheaded the establishment of a pediatric ICU and HDU, with expertise in difficult cannulations, intubation, invasive line insertions, and point-of-care ultrasound. She is an instructor in Pediatric Advanced Life Support and has multiple certifications, including research methodology from BMJ/UCSF.
medicalQualifications: MBBS, MD (Pediatrics), MRCPCH-UK, Fellowship in Pediatric Critical Care
clinicDepartment: Pediatric critical care services, Department of Paediatrics
schedule: Outpatient: Thursday 9am-2pm Anderson building; Inpatient: All weekdays 8am-4pm St Mary’s ward
location: The Nairobi Hospital, Anderson building, St Mary’s ward
awardsAndRecognition: Antimicrobial stewardship champion, Gertrude’s Children Hospital (2021); Certificate of participation and contribution to JCI accreditation, Gertrude’s Children Hospital (2018, 2021)
researchAndPublications: Successful Esophageal Replacement Surgery Post-corrosive in a 3-Year-Old with Esophageal Stricture (Ann Afr Surg, 2020); Severe combined immunodeficiency: a case series from a paediatric hospital in Kenya (Pan Afr Med J, 2021); Hospital acquired infections in a private paediatric hospital in Kenya (Pan Afr Med J, 2022); A rare costovertebral malformation in a Kenyan infant (Afr J Thoracic Crit Care Med, 2024); Paediatric Critical Care Services: Value In Saving Childrens Life In Our Region (The Nairobi Hospital Journal, 2022); Co-investigator in HIB-02/08 clinical trial (2009-2010); Ongoing: Epidemiology of respiratory pathogens (submitted to BMJ Open Respiratory Research); Neonatal spontaneous abdominal aortic thrombosis (case series)

name: Samuel Owuor Odede, OGW
title: Mr.
bio: Mr. Samuel Owuor Odede, OGW, is a Trauma and Orthopaedic Surgeon specializing in Hip and Knee Arthroplasty at The Nairobi Hospital, with 26 years of experience. Holding an MBChB, MPH (Harvard), MRCS (Ireland), MBA (Regent), and FRCS (Tr&Orth) England, he serves as Director of Medical Services & Research, delivering high-quality surgical care.
medicalQualifications: MBChB, MPH, MRCS(Ire), MBA, FRCS(Tr&Orth) England

name: Sylvia Nyanyu Mruttu
title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Sylvia Nyanyu Mruttu is a compassionate Obstetrician-Gynaecologist and Team Leader of the Department of Obstetrics and Gynaecology at The Nairobi Hospital, with over 12 years of experience. With an MBChB (2008) and MMED (2016) from the University of Nairobi and Aga Khan University Hospital, she integrates evidence-based practices with patient-centred care. She leads multidisciplinary teams to enhance service delivery, develop clinical protocols, and ensure high standards of care, while empowering patients through education and advocacy.
schedule: Mondays 9am-1pm Capital Centre Branch, Wednesdays 9am-1pm Anderson clinic

name: Tom Maseno Nyaboga
title: Dr.
bio: Dr. Tom Maseno Nyaboga is a board-registered Consultant Anatomical Pathologist at The Nairobi Hospital with 12 years of experience in diagnostic surgical pathology. Passionate about quality laboratory diagnosis, he has significant training in surgical pathology and cytopathology.

name: Zeinab Ahmed Mohamed
title: Doctor- Senior Registrar
bio: Dr. Zeinab Ahmed Mohamed is a highly motivated Paediatrician at The Nairobi Hospital with 10 years of experience. Holding an MBChB and MMED from the University of Nairobi, she is trained in aeromedical evacuation and committed to providing quality care and achieving exceptional patient outcomes through compassionate and comprehensive paediatric services.
licensingDetails: Kenya Medical Practitioners and Dentist Board-A11181
